RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 1 1M Turf CR: 71. Claiming Purse 16000. FOR ACCREDITED LA BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over On The Turf Since June 22 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500, if for $10,000, allowed 2 lbs. (If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over the turf course, it will be run on the main track at 1 Mile and 70 Yards).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PERFECT TOM was on the bit in the first turn, was angled in and asked to rate behind the front runners, saved ground, launched a bid at the five sixteenth pole, lengthened his stride moving into the stretch, shifted out at the three sixteenth pole, was asked and encouraged at the eighth pole, where he found another gear and drew off willingly. WESTERN STAR showed natural speed early, took the lead and the rail, raced in hands with a stalking rival to the outside, launched a bid at the three eighths pole, drew ahead, was encouraged and driven down the lane but could not sustain the bid and flattened out, was still good enough for second place today. NINEJUANJUAN CALL was off a tad slow, raced on the rail from off of the pace, and put in a mild bid late. JUDGMENTAL hopped at the start, was four wide and racing mid pack but had no impact. MAGIC LIGHTNING vied for the lead, stalked just off of the leader, raced three wide and faltered in the stretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Ninejuanjuan Call
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, rail, saved ground, mild run late

ENTRY.NAME: Judgmental
ENTRY.COMMENT: hopped start, mid pack, 4w, no impact

ENTRY.NAME: Western Star
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, led, rail, pace, in hands, bid 3/8, drew away, flattened

ENTRY.NAME: Magic Lightning
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, stalked, 3w, faltered.

ENTRY.NAME: Perfect Tom
ENTRY.COMMENT: keen, 3w, stalked, rated, bid 5-16th, encouraged 1/8, drew off

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 2 1M 70Y Dirt CR: 73. Claiming Purse 10000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: COASTAL CHAOS vied for the early lead from the outside, angled in and briefly raced between two other rivals on the lead, let the rival to the far outside go before the half mile pole and stalked that one, matched strides while stalking the leader through the turn, raced into the stretch still in company, repelled his company horse, challenged for the lead after he sixteenth pole, cleared that rival right before the wire and got up in time for the win. BIG STORY vied for the lead, aced four wide on the far outside, went on and took the lead before the half mile pole, set the pace, was given more rein at the the three eighths pole, was in full stride moving into the stretch, showed the way home but was caught in the last few jumps and had to settle for second place today. FETCHS BRAHM stalked the front runners in the two path, advanced on the inside and matched strides with the eventual winner at the seven sixteenth pole, matched strides into the stretch, dropped down to the rail but did not have enough today for the win but ran a respectable third. RED RAIDER XPRESS raced from mid pack in between rivals in the three path, launched a bid at the three eighth s pole, improved position into the stretch but had no late rally. COUNTRY CUT was off a step slow, raced from off of the pace, stayed on the rail, angled out into the five path at the quarter pole, was asked at the top of the lane, responded well closing but had to much ground to make up. BUTWAITTHERE'SMORE bumped at the start, raced on the rail, was inside of other foes, ran an even race. NOBLE HONOR vied for the lead, raced on the rail and briefly co led, drifted out into the four path near the three eighth s pole and faded. SLIM JIMMY was four wide, raced from mid pack but was never involved. MORO LEGEND was two wide while racing mid pack, then tired. DENS DEVILLE stumbled at the start, recovered and was bumped by another foe, raced off of the pace and never got involved.

ENTRY.NAME: Country Cut
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, rail, saved ground, shifted 5 wide, 1/4,

ENTRY.NAME: Butwaitthere'smore
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped, mid pack, rail, even

ENTRY.NAME: Dens Deville
ENTRY.COMMENT: stumbled start, bumped foe, off pace, was never involved

ENTRY.NAME: Noble Honor
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, rail, led briely, drifted out, 4w, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Slim Jimmy
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4w, mid pack , never involved

ENTRY.NAME: Red Raider Xpress
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, between, 3w, lacked late rally

ENTRY.NAME: Fetchs Brahm
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, 2w, advanced inside 7-16th, matched, rail, not enough

ENTRY.NAME: Moro Legend
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, 2w, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Coastal Chaos
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, btwn, stalked,3w, matched, cleared, up in time

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Mike Buckley, Meg Buckley & Tim Thornton

ENTRY.NAME: Big Story
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, 4w, led, bid 3/8, caught late, settled for second

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 3 1M Turf CR: 86. Claiming Purse 14000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES OR WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE JULY 22, 2022. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $15,000, if for $12,500, allowed 2 lbs. (If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over the turf course, it will be run on the main track at 1 Mile and 70 Yards).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SHAMAYIM raced on the rail wile stalking the leaders, launched a bid at the three eighths pole, shifted out into the three path, split rivals at the quarter pole, took the lead by the three sixteenth pole and drew off for the win.. HALEYS SAILOR was racing in the middle of the pack, raced on the rail, saved ground as improved position down the back side, shifted into the three path in the upper stretch, responded well to encouragement, was asked again at the eighth pole, continued to close well but could not get to the winner but ran a game second. M AND M'S CUSTOM raced on the rail on the inside of other foes, was mid pack, maintained position, angled out five wide in the upper stretch, drifted out even more but responded well to encouragement getting up for third. PHARME'S PHAITH raced mid pack in the three path in between horses, shifted out into the six path at the quarter pole but did not have enough late. BIG COUNTRY was off slow, raced on the rail, made one long clean run, and closed well. GUITARTUITION PLZZ stalked the early pace, raced in the three path, held that position until he launched a bid at the three eighths pole, improved, angled out into the four path at the quarter pole, was in contention but finished even. COHERE was off mid pack, found himself racing in the four path on the outside of a set of four, was floated out at the quarter pole and raced eight wide down the stretch. GIMME SOME MO raced two wide while stalking the leaders, was keen in the bridle, briefly led at the five sixteenth pole, was collared in the upper stretch and faltered in the lane. HELIOCHROME vied for the lead, raced on the rail, set the early pace, then was collared by the quarter pole and faded. HARDCORE FOLKLORE was off of the pace, raced three wide, improved position, launched a bid at the three eighths pole but to no avail. SILENT TAP settled into the middle of the field, raced four wide, loomed closer down the back side, then faded.

ENTRY.NAME: Heliochrome
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, led, rail, pace, collared, faded

ENTRY.NAME: M and M's Custom
ENTRY.COMMENT: rail, mid pack, sifted 5w, closed

ENTRY.NAME: Haleys Sailor
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, rail, improved, saved ground, shifted out, closed

ENTRY.NAME: Pharme's Phaith
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, between, 3w, angled out 6 wide, 1/4, not enough

ENTRY.NAME: Cohere
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, 4w, shifted 8 wide, stretch

ENTRY.NAME: Shamayim
ENTRY.COMMENT: rail, stalked, bid 3/8, shift4ed out split 1/4, cleared 3-16th,

ENTRY.NAME: Big Country
ENTRY.OWNER: Duffy's Racing Stable LLC and Heider Racing Stables LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, rail, one run, closed

ENTRY.NAME: Guitartuition Plzz
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, 3w, bid 3/8, shifted 4 wide, 1/4, finished even

ENTRY.NAME: Hardcore Folklore
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, 3w, improved, bid 3/8, no avail

ENTRY.NAME: Silent Tap
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, 4w, improved, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Gimme Some Mo
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2w, stalked, keen, led 5-16th, faltered

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 4 1M 70Y Dirt CR: 61. Maiden Claiming Purse 11000. FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $7,500.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FIVE O FOX stalked the pace, raced two wide, improved position, matched strides and led in a set of three, launched a bid the three eighths pole, took command at the five sixteenth pole, and drew off. HOWL YEAH was off a bit slow, was far off of the pace, was allowed to settle, found his stride and was gaining ground by the half mile pole, saved ground, shifted out at the quarter pole, was asked and responded well and out finished the rest of the field, while he could not catch the winner he ran a game second. ROSIE'S BOY vied for the lead, raced on the rail, ended up stalking the pace, ran even. SEEKING CHROME stalked the pace setter from the three path, raced in between foes as he advanced closer to the lead, matched strides with the leaders at the seven sixteenth pole, launched a bid and was encouraged at the three eighth s pole, the faded. CUNNING stalked the leaders, raced five wide and ran an even race. ROYAL DE BE was off of the pace, raced wide in the five path, but showed little. MR CANDIDO vied for the lead, set the pace, raced on the rail, then tired. GAELIC WARRIOR trailed the field, was pulled up and vanned off. GAELIC WARRIOR PULLED UP AND VANNED OFF.

ENTRY.NAME: Gaelic Warrior
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed early, pulled up vanned off

ENTRY.NAME: Seeking Chrome
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, 3w, between, advanced 1/2,matched 7-16th, bid3/8, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Rosie's Boy
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, rail, stalked, ran even

ENTRY.NAME: Royal de Be
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, 5w, showed little

ENTRY.NAME: Mr Candido
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, led, rail, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Five O Fox
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, 2w, improved, matched, led 5-16th, drew off

ENTRY.NAME: Cunning
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, 5w, ran even

ENTRY.NAME: Howl Yeah
ENTRY.OWNER: Smith Mike Smith Daria and East Austin Racing Stables LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, far back, found stride 1/2, shifted 5 wide, 1/4, closed

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 5 1M Turf CR: 101. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 26000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, STATE BRED OR TRIAL OR CLAIMING PRICE $30,000. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over On The Turf Since June 22 , 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $30,000 Condition eligibility preferred. (If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over the turf course, it will be run on the main track at 1 Mile and 70 Yards).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: OH MY ACHING ARCH raced in the three path, stalked the pace, launched a bid at the three eight s pole, circled the field through the turn in the three path, was driven in the upper stretch, challenged for the lead at the eighth pole, battled, got in front by the last sixteenth of a mile and was bale to hold sway. PAYNTER PARTY vied for the lead, raced on the rail, set the pace while showing the way, was challenged at the eight pole, battled for the lead, gave way after the sixteenth pole and just missed. SEDUCTIVE U S A was off a bit slow, raced three wide, settled off of the pace, moved up and improved position, launched a bid at the three eighths pole, was encouraged and responded well closing between rivals, repelled rivals on each side, getting up for third. BRITTS A CLOSER raced in the middle of the field three wide, shifted into the six path in the upper stretch but did not have enough today. SILVER GALAXY was off of the pace early, traveled in the two path, raced in between foes, angled out into the eight path in the upper stretch but made no head way. FRED'STWIRLINCANDY stalked the pace from the three path, maintained position until the quarter pole then faltered. DEVAMANI (FR) showed little. STANS HOOKIN BULL was never involved. EXTIRPATOR raced on the rail, was asked to rate and stalked the early pace and tired after the quarter pole. BALLINONABUDJET trailed through out.

ENTRY.NAME: Silver Galaxy
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, 2w, between, angled out 8 wide, upper

ENTRY.COMMENT: showed little

ENTRY.COMMENT: rail, rated, stalked, tired

ENTRY.COMMENT: vie rail, led, battled, just missed

ENTRY.OWNER: Davis Wayne T and Wilson Rebecca
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3w, stalked, bid 3/8, circled, challenged 1/8, led 1/16th, held

ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, 3w, settled, advanced, bid3/8, encouraged, between, csd

ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, 3w, faltered

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 6 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 70. Claiming Purse 18000. FOR ACCREDITED LA BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DEAL ME A PENNY staked the leader from the two path, too the lead at the half mile pole, took a breather through the turn, battled, took the win. SHEZA SALTY GAL raced from mid pack, loomed up to the front by the half mile pole, had the lead, was collared in the stretch and settled for second. HOPEITSMYLUCKYDAY vied for the lead, stalked the pace and ran even. MUCHMORETHANREADY was off a touch slow, saved ground by racing on the rail, improved position with a late bid. DAT GUITAR showed little. LITTLE E was never involved.

ENTRY.COMMENT: was never involved
